00043 #define PCI_DMA_64BIT                  0xffffffffffffffffULL

00048 /** PCI VendorId Device Id */
00049 #define  OCTEON_CN38XX_PASS2_PCIID    0x4177d
00050 #define  OCTEON_CN38XX_PASS3_PCIID    0x5177d
00051 #define  OCTEON_CN58XX_PCIID          0x40177d
00052 #define  OCTEON_CN56XX_PCIID          0x50177d
00053 #define  OCTEON_CN63XX_PCIID          0x90177d
00054 #define  OCTEON_CN68XX_PCIID          0x91177d
00055 #define  OCTEON_CN66XX_PCIID          0x92177d
00056 
00057 
00058 /** Driver identifies chips by these Ids, created by clubbing together
00059     DeviceId+RevisionId; Where Revision Id is not used to distinguish
00060     between chips, a value of 0 is used for revision id.
00061 */
00062 #define  OCTEON_CN38XX_PASS2          0x0004
00063 #define  OCTEON_CN38XX_PASS3          0x0005
00064 
00065 #define  OCTEON_CN58XX                0x0040
00066 #define  OCTEON_CN56XX                0x0050
00067 #define  OCTEON_CN63XX                0x0090
00068 #define  OCTEON_CN68XX                0x0091
00069 #define  OCTEON_CN66XX                0x0092

00074 /** Endian-swap modes supported by Octeon. */
00075 enum octeon_pci_swap_mode {
00076     OCTEON_PCI_PASSTHROUGH     = 0,
00077     OCTEON_PCI_64BIT_SWAP      = 1,
00078     OCTEON_PCI_32BIT_BYTE_SWAP = 2,
00079     OCTEON_PCI_32BIT_LW_SWAP   = 3
00080 } ;

00088 /** Octeon Device state.
00089  *  Each octeon device goes through each of these states 
00090  *  as it is initialized.
00091  */
00092 #define    OCT_DEV_BEGIN_STATE            0x0
00093 #define    OCT_DEV_PCI_MAP_DONE           0x1
00094 #define    OCT_DEV_DISPATCH_INIT_DONE     0x2
00095 #ifdef USE_BUFFER_POOL
00096 #define    OCT_DEV_BUF_POOL_INIT_DONE     0x3
00097 #endif
00098 #define    OCT_DEV_INSTR_QUEUE_INIT_DONE  0x4
00099 #define    OCT_DEV_PEND_LIST_INIT_DONE    0x5
00100 #define    OCT_DEV_RESP_LIST_INIT_DONE    0x6
00101 #define    OCT_DEV_DROQ_INIT_DONE         0x7
00102 #define    OCT_DEV_HOST_OK                0x8
00103 #define    OCT_DEV_CORE_OK                0x9
00104 #define    OCT_DEV_RUNNING                0xA
00105 #define    OCT_DEV_IN_RESET               0xB
00106 #define    OCT_DEV_RESET_CLEANUP_DONE     0xC
00107 #define    OCT_DEV_STOPPING               0xD
00108 #define    OCT_DEV_STOPPED                0xE
00109 #define    OCT_DEV_STATE_INVALID          0xF
00110 
00111 #define    OCT_DEV_STATES                 OCT_DEV_STATE_INVALID

00117 #define OCTEON_MAX_MODULES 3
00118 enum {
00119     OCTEON_START_MODULE=1,
00120     OCTEON_RESET_MODULE=2,
00121     OCTEON_STOP_MODULE
00122 };

00127 /*---------------------------DISPATCH LIST-------------------------------*/
00128 
00129 
00130 /** The dispatch list entry.
00131  *  The driver keeps a record of functions registered for each 
00132  *  response header opcode in this structure. Since the opcode is
00133  *  hashed to index into the driver's list, more than one opcode
00134  *  can hash to the same entry, in which case the list field points
00135  *  to a linked list with the other entries.
00136  */
00137 typedef struct {
00138 
00139   /** List head for this entry */
00140     cavium_list_t             list;
00141 
00142   /** The opcode for which the above dispatch function & arg should be
00143       used */
00144     octeon_opcode_t           opcode;
00145 
00146   /** The function to be called for a packet received by the driver */
00147     octeon_dispatch_fn_t      dispatch_fn;
00148 
00149   /** The application specified argument to be passed to the above
00150       function along with the received packet */
00151     void                      *arg;
00152 
00153 } octeon_dispatch_t;
00154 
00155 
00156 
00157 /** The dispatch list structure. */
00158 typedef struct {
00159 
00160     cavium_spinlock_t      lock;
00161 
00162     /** Count of dispatch functions currently registered */
00163     uint32_t               count;
00164 
00165     /** The list of dispatch functions */
00166     octeon_dispatch_t     *dlist;
00167 
00168 
00169 } octeon_dispatch_list_t;
00170

00172 
00173

00178 /*-----------------------  THE OCTEON DEVICE  ---------------------------*/
00179 
00180 
00181 
00182 #define OCT_MEM_REGIONS     3
00183 /** PCI address space mapping information.
00184  *  Each of the 3 address spaces given by BAR0, BAR2 and BAR4 of
00185  *  Octeon gets mapped to different physical address spaces in
00186  *  the kernel. 
00187  */
00188 typedef struct  {
00189 
00190   /** PCI address to which the BAR is mapped. */
00191    unsigned long   start;
00192 
00193   /** Length of this PCI address space. */
00194    unsigned long   len;
00195 
00196   /** Length that has been mapped to phys. address space. */
00197    unsigned long   mapped_len;
00198 
00199   /** The physical address to which the PCI address space is mapped. */
00200    void           *hw_addr;
00201 
00202   /** Flag indicating the mapping was successful. */
00203    int             done;
00204 
00205 }octeon_mmio;
00206 
00207 
00208 #define   MAX_OCTEON_MAPS    32
00209 
00210 
00211 /** Map of Octeon core memory address to Octeon BAR1 indexed space. */
00212 typedef  struct  {
00213 
00214   /** Starting Core address mapped */
00215   uint64_t      core_addr;
00216 
00217   /** Physical address (of the BAR1 mapped space) 
00218       corressponding to core_addr. */
00219   void       *mapped_addr;
00220 
00221   /** Indicator that the mapping is valid. */
00222   int         valid;
00223 
00224 } octeon_range_table_t;

00233     uint32_t    iq;

00236 
00237     uint32_t    iq64B;
00238 
00239 }  octeon_io_enable_t;

00248 struct octeon_reg_list {
00249 
00250     uint32_t            *pci_win_wr_addr_hi;
00251     uint32_t            *pci_win_wr_addr_lo;
00252     uint64_t            *pci_win_wr_addr;
00253 
00254     uint32_t            *pci_win_rd_addr_hi;
00255     uint32_t            *pci_win_rd_addr_lo;
00256     uint64_t            *pci_win_rd_addr;
00257 
00258     uint32_t            *pci_win_wr_data_hi;
00259     uint32_t            *pci_win_wr_data_lo;
00260     uint64_t            *pci_win_wr_data;
00261 
00262     uint32_t            *pci_win_rd_data_hi;
00263     uint32_t            *pci_win_rd_data_lo;
00264     uint64_t            *pci_win_rd_data;
00265 };

00268 
00269 struct octeon_fn_list {
00270 
00271     void                (* setup_iq_regs)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE *, int);
00272     void                (* setup_oq_regs)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE *, int);
00273 
00274     cvm_intr_return_t   (* interrupt_handler)(void *);
00275     int                 (* soft_reset)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE *);
00276     int                 (* setup_device_regs)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE *);
00277     void                (* reinit_regs)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE *);
00278     void                (* bar1_idx_setup)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE *, uint64_t, int, int);
00279     void                (* bar1_idx_write)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE *, int, uint32_t);
00280     uint32_t            (* bar1_idx_read)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE *, int);
00281     uint32_t            (* update_iq_read_idx)(octeon_instr_queue_t  *);
00282 
00283     void                (* enable_oq_pkt_time_intr)(octeon_device_t *, int );
00284     void                (* disable_oq_pkt_time_intr)(octeon_device_t *, int );
00285 
00286     void                (* enable_interrupt)(void  *);
00287     void                (* disable_interrupt)(void  *);
00288 
00289     void                (* enable_io_queues)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE  *);
00290     void                (* disable_io_queues)(struct _OCTEON_DEVICE  *);
00291 };

00299 #ifdef USE_DDOQ_THREADS

00301 #define CVM_MAX_DDOQ_THREADS        8 //16
00302 #define CVM_DDOQ_MAX_THREAD_PKTS    (2 * MAX_OCTEON_DMA_QUEUES * 256)//CNTQ_PKTS_PER_INTERRUPT];
00303 //#define CVM_DDOQ_MAX_THREAD_PKTS  (2 * MAX_OCTEON_DMA_QUEUES * 512)
00304 
00305 typedef struct cvm_ddoq_thread_info {
00306     int ddoq_id;
00307     int req_id;
00308     int num_pkts;
00309 } octeon_ddoq_thread_info_t;
00310 
00311 typedef struct cvm_ddoq_thread {
00312    octeon_device_t       *oct_dev;
00313    cvm_kthread_t         thread;
00314    cavium_wait_channel   wc;
00315    int               stop_thread;
00316    cavium_atomic_t       thread_active;
00317    cavium_atomic_t      ddoq_pkts_queued;
00318 
00319    cavium_spinlock_t    th_lock;
00320    int                  th_read_idx;
00321    int                  th_write_idx;
00322    
00323    /* On each interrupt we can handle at most */
00324    octeon_ddoq_thread_info_t th_info[CVM_DDOQ_MAX_THREAD_PKTS];
00325 } cvm_ddoq_thread_t;
00326 #endif

00329 /** The Octeon device. 
00330  *  Each Octeon device has this structure to represent all its
00331  *  components.
00332  */
00333 struct _OCTEON_DEVICE {
00334 
00335    /** Lock for this Octeon device */
00336    cavium_spinlock_t        oct_lock;
00337 
00338    /** OS dependent PCI device pointer */
00339    cavium_pci_device_t     *pci_dev;
00340 
00341    /** Chip specific information. */
00342    void                    *chip;
00343 
00344    /** Octeon Chip type. */
00345    uint16_t                 chip_id;
00346    uint16_t                 rev_id;
00347 
00348    /** This device's id - set by the driver. */
00349    uint16_t                 octeon_id;
00350 
00351    /** This device's PCIe port used for traffic. */
00352    uint16_t                 pcie_port;
00353 
00354 
00355    /** The state of this device */
00356    cavium_atomic_t          status;
00357 
00358    /** memory mapped io range */
00359    octeon_mmio              mmio[OCT_MEM_REGIONS];
00360 
00361    struct octeon_reg_list   reg_list;
00362 
00363    struct octeon_fn_list    fn_list;
00364 
00365    cavium_atomic_t          interrupts;
00366 
00367    cavium_atomic_t          in_interrupt;
00368 
00369    int                      num_iqs;
00370 
00371    /** The 4 input instruction queues */
00372    octeon_instr_queue_t     *instr_queue[MAX_OCTEON_INSTR_QUEUES];
00373 
00374    int                       pend_list_size;
00375    octeon_pending_list_t    *plist;
00376 
00377    /** The doubly-linked list of instruction response */
00378    octeon_response_list_t    response_list[MAX_RESPONSE_LISTS];
00379 
00380 
00381    int                        num_oqs;
00382 
00383    /** The 4 output queues  */
00384    octeon_droq_t            *droq[MAX_OCTEON_OUTPUT_QUEUES];
00385 
00386 #if  !defined(USE_DROQ_THREADS)
00387    /** Tasklet structures for this device. */
00388    struct tasklet_struct     droq_tasklet;
00389 #endif
00390    struct tasklet_struct     comp_tasklet;
00391 
00392    uint32_t                  napi_mask;
00393 
00394    void                     *poll_list;
00395    cavium_spinlock_t         poll_lock;
00396 
00397    struct tasklet_struct     cntq_tasklet;
00398 
00399    uint32_t                  cntq_ready;
00400 
00401    /* The 2 Octeon DMA Counter Queues */
00402    void                     *cntq[MAX_OCTEON_DMA_QUEUES];
00403 
00404    /* The DDOQ lookup table */
00405    void                     *ddoq_list;
00406 
00407    /** Operations on the DMA queues */
00408    octeon_dma_ops_t          dma_ops;
00409 
00410 
00411    /** A table maintaining maps of core-addr to BAR1 mapped address. */
00412    octeon_range_table_t      range_table[MAX_OCTEON_MAPS];
00413 
00414    /** Total number of core-address ranges mapped (Upto 32). */
00415    uint32_t                  map_count;
00416 
00417 
00418    octeon_io_enable_t        io_qmask;
00419 
00420 
00421    /** List of dispatch functions */
00422    octeon_dispatch_list_t    dispatch;
00423 
00424 #ifdef USE_BUFFER_POOL
00425    /** The buffer pool implementation */
00426    cavium_buffer_t           buf[BUF_POOLS];
00427    cavium_frag_buf_t         fragments[MAX_BUFFER_CHUNKS];
00428    uint16_t                  fragment_free_list[MAX_BUFFER_CHUNKS];
00429    uint16_t                  fragment_free_list_index;
00430    cavium_spinlock_t         fragment_lock;
00431 #endif
00432 
00433    /** The /proc file entries */
00434    void                     *proc_root_dir;
00435 
00436    /** Statistics for this octeon device. Does not include IQ, DROQ stats */
00437    oct_dev_stats_t           stats;
00438 
00439    /** IRQ assigned to this device. */
00440    int                       irq;
00441 
00442    int                       msi_on;
00443 
00444    /** The core application is running in this mode. See octeon-drv-opcodes.h
00445        for values. */
00446    int                       app_mode;
00447 #ifdef CVMCS_DMA_IC
00448    /* When DMA interrupt raised we have these many packets DMAed by Octeon */
00449    cavium_atomic_t          dma_cnt_to_process;
00450 #endif
00451 
00452 #ifdef USE_DDOQ_THREADS
00453    cvm_ddoq_thread_t         ddoq_thread[CVM_MAX_DDOQ_THREADS];
00454 #endif
00455 
00456    /** The name given to this device. */
00457    char                      device_name[32];
00458 
00459 };

00472 /*------------------ Function Prototypes ----------------------*/
00473 
00474 /** Allocate memory for Input and Output queue structures for a octeon device */
00475 octeon_device_t *   octeon_allocate_device_mem(int);
00476 
00477 
00478 /** Free memory for Input and Output queue structures for a octeon device */
00479 void octeon_free_device_mem(octeon_device_t *);
00480 
00481 /** Look up a free entry in the octeon_device table and allocate resources
00482     for the octeon_device_t  structure for an octeon device. Called at init
00483     time. */
00484 octeon_device_t  *
00485 octeon_allocate_device(int pci_id);
00486 
00487 
00488 /**  Initialize the driver's dispatch list which is a mix of a hash table
00489   *  and a linked list. This is done at driver load time.
00490   *  @param octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device structure.
00491   *  @return 0 on success, else -ve error value
00492   */
00493 int    octeon_init_dispatch_list(octeon_device_t  *octeon_dev);
00494 
00495 
00496 
00497 /**  Delete the driver's dispatch list and all registered entries.
00498   *  This is done at driver unload time.
00499   *  @param octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device structure.
00500   */
00501 void    octeon_delete_dispatch_list(octeon_device_t  *octeon_dev);
00502 
00503 
00504 
00505 
00506 /**  Register dispatch functions for packets from core that are of 
00507   *  interest to the driver.
00508   *  @param octeon_id - octeon device id.
00509   */
00510 void    octeon_setup_driver_dispatches(uint32_t octeon_id);
00511 
00512 
00513 
00514 
00515 /* Perform hot reset of Octeon device. The Octeon input & output queues
00516  * do not have to be re-allocated. The existing queue setup is reprogrammed
00517  * into the octeon device after this reset. */
00518 int
00519 octeon_hot_reset(octeon_device_t  *octeon_dev);
00520 
00521 
00522 
00523 /** Get the octeon device pointer.
00524  *  @param octeon_id  - The id for which the octeon device pointer is required.
00525  *  @return Success: Octeon device pointer.
00526  *  @return Failure: NULL.
00527  */
00528 octeon_device_t *  get_octeon_device(uint32_t octeon_id);
00529 
00530 
00531 
00532 /** Gets the octeon device id when the device structure is given.
00533  *  @return - The octeon device id.
00534  */
00535 uint32_t  get_octeon_id(octeon_device_t *octeon_dev);
00536 
00537 
00538 /** Return the core clock cycles per microsecond. */
00539 uint32_t
00540 octeon_get_cycles_per_usec(octeon_device_t  *oct);
00541 
00542 
00543 /** Called by the base device driver at init time to initialize the
00544   * module handler data structures.
00545   */
00546 void   octeon_init_module_handler_list(void);
00547 
00548 /** Called by the base driver (in the poll thread) for each octeon
00549   * device when its state changes to CORE_OK (core application 
00550   * informs the host of type of application running). This routine
00551   * checks for handlers for the application type and calls the
00552   * handler start routine.
00553   * @param app_type  - The application type detected for the octeon device.
00554   * @param octeon_id - The device id for the octeon device.
00555   * @return -ENODEV if no handler was found for the application type or an
00556   *         invalid octeon id was passed.
00557   *         -EINVAL if invalid operation was specified.
00558   *         0 on success.
00559   */
00560 int    octeon_start_module(uint32_t app_type, uint32_t  octeon_id);
00561 
00562 
00563 
00564 
00565 /** Called by the base driver for each octeon device when the device is being
00566   * reset (due to hot-reset initiated by user). This function calls the reset
00567   * routine of handlers for the application type specified.
00568   * @param app_type  - The application type detected for the octeon device.
00569   * @param octeon_id - The device id for the octeon device.
00570   * @return -ENODEV if no handler was found for the application type or an
00571   *         invalid octeon id was passed.
00572   *         -EINVAL if invalid operation was specified.
00573   *         0 on success.
00574   */
00575 int    octeon_reset_module(uint32_t app_type, uint32_t  octeon_id);
00576 
00577 
00578 
00579 
00580 /** Called by the base driver for each octeon device when the device is being
00581   * removed (either due to hot-plug or due to base module unload). This 
00582   * function calls the stop routine of handlers for the application type
00583   * specified.
00584   * @param app_type  - The application type detected for the octeon device.
00585   * @param octeon_id - The device id for the octeon device.
00586   * @return -ENODEV if no handler was found for the application type or an
00587   *         invalid octeon id was passed.
00588   *         -EINVAL if invalid operation was specified.
00589   *         0 on success.
00590   */
00591 int    octeon_stop_module(uint32_t app_type, uint32_t  octeon_id);
